instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-1722: What is 820-1722? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
Hi
i have this macbook air where i find a liquid spill on <RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7612</RESISTOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7615</CAPACITOR> on <SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL>, i change all this component but the problem is same, fan start 5 sec & shutdown
<SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL> fall 1,043V to 0V when the mac shutdown.
I don't find where <SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL> is generate, do you know?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
[QUOTE="raainxx, post: 27774"]i have this macbook air where i find a liquid spill on <RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7612</RESISTOR> & <CAPACITOR>C7615</CAPACITOR> on <SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL>, i change all this component but the problem is same, fan start 5 sec & shutdown
[/QUOTE]

<SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL> has at most likely nothing to do with the reason its shutting down. The system is simply going back into a earlier power stage (S5) so the voltage simply does not get generated anymore.

Issues like this can be a pain in the butt.
How does the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area look like (No corrosion)?

I feel like duke might know better on how to solve this

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
ok thanks.
I look near the smc no corrosion, i resolder <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> nothing better.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>=3,34V
I try with a new magsafe board and new cable <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1722</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, same issue.
all the board seems clean

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: Is Vcore present when the fan spins? Does it shutdown and power on again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: I check tomorow for the Vcore but no shutdown and stay off, but when i short power pad, he start again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
when you say VCORE, is it <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1,74V and fall when fan stop.
The led is orange without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: Could be anything. Corrosion under SMC, traces <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> to Y1905? JTAG?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
Corrosion near <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> is it cause my problem?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: Possibly, <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> is there for the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: Is the keyboard disconnected when you try?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> climb to 3,34 and fall at 0V.
i disconnect keyboard, only magsafe board with cable left board and power adapter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: There's going to be corrosion somewhere. Time to inspect visually for damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
I inspect all the board under microscope, i put the board in ultrasound cleaner, the board is clean, no corrosion on the board.
i check with scope the signal Y1905 ok i have <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_X2</SIGNAL> at 25mhz but nothing in output of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, all <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>=<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL>=3,34V during my board is ON.
is it <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> bad?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> is fine as the only output needed to work is 32kHz on pin 12. Without that the board would not even power on.

Does it stay on for 5 seconds then off and then repeat forever?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message:
i have in fact the clock in pin 12 32Khz and always on but the board start and shutdown.
i can't find where is the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: I ask again: Does it stay on for 5 seconds then off and then repeat forever or just stay off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: no just stay off, if i want to restart the board i need to short the power pad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan 5 sec and shutdown
threads.message: Either crap under SMC or the termination resistors/traces from <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> to SMC.
